p: In contrast, M. lucens displays niche plasticity: significant negative correlations between the proportion north of the isotherms and the latitude of the isotherm ( Fig. 5c, Table 1a) were observed and the species unusually moved south in both the periods of cooling and warming, 87 and 38 km, respectively ( Fig. 6d–f and Table 1b). The abundance of the species, however, fell in the period of cooling and has not recovered in the period of warming ( Fig. 5d).
